0.title: Man dragged while getting down from moving train in Guj, video surfaces
0.article_body: The Railways Ministry tweeted a video on Tuesday showing a passenger being dragged on the platform after he tried to get down from a moving train at Surat railway station in Gujarat. Reportedly, the train was moving at 20 kmph when the incident happened. The man said to be in his 40s got saved after the guard applied emergency brakes.

1.title: France 'strongly' urges its citizens to leave Russia amid conflict
1.article_body: The French government has "strongly" urged its citizens to leave Russia if their presence is "not essential". This comes following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine and the closure of airspace between Russia and the European Union. The government also urged French citizens to "defer any trips to Russia". The US on Monday issued a similar appeal to American nationals in Russia.

2.title: Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test is momentous for Indian cricket: Ganguly
2.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said that Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test in Mohali tomorrow is momentous for Indian cricket. "Virat has had a fantastic career. He still has time to achieve greater milestones," added Ganguly in a video message shared by BCCI. Virat will become the 12th Indian cricketer to play 100 Tests.

3.title: I dumped my bags to carry my dog: Indian girl seen in viral pic on escaping from Ukraine
3.article_body: Indian student Arya Aldrin, who carried her pet dog Zaira from Ukraine amid war, arrived in Delhi on Thursday. "At one stretch, I had to walk 20 km...At one point she was tired...so I dumped my bags to carry her," said Arya. "I was firm...Zaira will accompany me...Some people laughed at me," the 2nd year MBBS student from Kerala added.

4.title: 'Jhund' is a masterpiece and will make a lot of heads turn: Dhanush
4.article_body: Talking about Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund', Dhanush said the movie is simply mind-blowing and a masterpiece, adding that the film will make a lot of heads turn and is an experience that everyone should go through. "Very happy to have witnessed this magic. Speechless. Simply fantastic," stated Dhanush. "Amit ji has done unbelievable work," said Dhanush.

5.title: Nawab Malik's ED custody extended till March 7 in money laundering case
5.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has been granted additional custody of Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik till March 7 by a PMLA court. The NCP leader was arrested in connection with a money laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim. He has claimed that ED is acting against him out of political vendetta as he has been critical of the central government.

6.title: Priyanka lights diya while offering prayers in Varanasi, video surfaces
6.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra offered prayers on the banks of the Ganga river in Varanasi. In a video that has surfaced on social media, she can be seen lighting a 'diya' and offering it in the Ganga river. Priyanka reached Kabir Chaura Math in Varanasi on Thursday and she is expected to stay there for the next three days.

7.title: Tigress rescued from tiger reserve dies during treatment at Bilaspur Zoo
7.article_body: A 13-year-old tigress died during treatment in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur district on Wednesday, a forest official said. The tigress was rescued from Achanakmar Tiger Reserve in June last year and was taken to Kanan Pendari Zoological Garden in Bilaspur for treatment. A seven-member committee was formed for her treatment, however, the animal died due to age-related ailments.

8.title: B'luru man poses as software engineer, cheats Raj local of ₹1.76 crore
8.article_body: A man was arrested in Bengaluru for cheating a resident of Rajasthan's Udaipur of ₹1.76 crore, police said. He posed as a software engineer from Apple and told the victim he could get him iPhones at prices 30-40% cheaper than the market. Subsequently, the victim paid him the amount in instalments and got cheated. The accused was brought to Udaipur.

9.title: Gold ornaments worth ₹16 crore seized on Konark express, 4 held
9.article_body: Gold ornaments worth ₹16 crore were seized from Mumbai-Bhubaneswar Konark Express by the Government Railway Police (GRP). Four people were said to have been detained in connection with the incident for interrogation after they failed to produce valid GST documents. Police said the detainees had been travelling with four bags, each containing 8 kg of gold ornaments.

10.title: Sharp dip in COVID-19 cases, 0.7% of global cases from India: Govt
10.article_body: Union Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said on Thursday a sharp decline in COVID-19 cases has been observed and that only 0.7% of global cases are reported in India. "On (an) average around 11,000 COVID-19 cases are reported on a weekly basis in India," he said. The active caseload has also declined to 77,000, the government said.

11.title: Today, music is made for Instagram Reels and that's sad: Salim Merchant
11.article_body: Music composer Salim Merchant said that music today requires social media validation. "Today, music is made for Instagram Reels...Even creators are making music that's pleasing to ears for a short span of time. That's sad," he added. Salim said that he also doesn't find films very exciting nowadays. "I shouldn't be saying it, but it's the truth," he added.

12.title: Should I run away like our seculars surrendered to terrorism?: Vivek
12.article_body: Talking about the release of his upcoming film 'The Kashmir Files' clashing with Prabhas-starrer 'Radhe Shyam', director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Should I...run away like our...seculars..., intellectuals surrendered to terrorism in case of Kashmir Genocide?" "Should I surrender to the might? Whenever I release 'The Kashmir Files' a...star based, hyped up film will release alongside," added Vivek.

13.title: Siraj can bowl long overs, he has shown he can bowl tough overs: Agarkar
13.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar has said pacer Mohammed Siraj is someone who can bowl the "long overs" for the team in Tests. "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami are back...[but] whether in England or at times in South Africa, Siraj has shown that he can bowl the tough overs," Agarkar added. So far, Siraj has picked 36 wickets in 12 Tests.

14.title: Palihapitiya accused of insider sale of Virgin Galactic shares worth $315 mn
14.article_body: Former Virgin Galactic Chairman Chamath Palihapitiya has been accused of selling 10 million of firm's shares for $315 million by leveraging his position before quitting. The lawsuit also alleges Founder Richard Branson nabbed $301 million by selling shares while stock price was "artificially inflated". The suit was filed on behalf of Virgin Galactic to seek damages from directors and officers.

15.title: BSF seizes silver worth ₹2 lakh from farmer on Indo-Bangladesh border
15.article_body: The BSF seized silver balls worth ₹2 lakh from a suspected farmer on the Indo-Bangladesh border on Tuesday. The discovery was made after a soldier on duty saw a suspicious person carrying some luggage on cycle and stopped the person to search the goods. An FIR was lodged against the suspect, identified as Rabban Sheikh, at Lalgola Police Station.

16.title: This is the spirit in which foreign policy should be run: Tharoor on meet with Jaishankar
16.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday praised External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for a "comprehensive briefing" on the evacuation of Indians from war-torn Ukraine. "This is the spirit in which foreign policy should be run," Tharoor tweeted after the meeting. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi were also part of the meeting that discussed Russia-Ukraine crisis.

17.title: It won't make a difference: Gavaskar on Bumrah's inexperience in home Tests
17.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar, on being asked if Jasprit Bumrah's inexperience at home will affect his performance in Sri Lanka Tests, said Bumrah is too good a bowler and it won't make a difference. So far, Bumrah has played only two of his 27 Tests on home soil. "Any kind of conditions, he will get you wickets anytime," Gavaskar added.

18.title: Kohli used to be a chubby guy who would eat anything: Harbhajan
18.article_body: Terming Virat Kohli's will to succeed as "unbelievable", Harbhajan Singh said Kohli brought about a transformation in Team India's fitness culture having earlier been a "chubby guy" who would eat "anything and everything". "After a few years when I saw him, he was totally a different guy, knowing...what he wants to do, what is good for him," added Harbhajan.

19.title: Fire breaks out in Zakaria Industrial Estate in Mumbai's Byculla
19.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in the Zakaria Industrial Estate of Byculla in Mumbai on Thursday. As many as eight fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire. As per the officials, firefighting operations were immediately launched. The cause that led to the fire has, however, not yet been determined.

20.title: Multi-crore inland waterway project to be developed in Mizoram
20.article_body: An inland waterway transport project will be developed across a 23-km stretch of Khawthlangtuipui-Tuichawng rivers in Mizoram, an official said. The project, estimated to cost ₹22.93 crore, will cater to the needs of the southern districts. "We must optimally utilise our rivers as economic, swift and ecologically sound means of transport," Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal said on Wednesday.

21.title: Gurugram to get 90 smart signals to ease traffic flow: GMDA officials
21.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) has started working on a project to convert 90 traffic signals in the city to smart signals to ease traffic flow, officials said on Wednesday. The authority has already issued tenders for the project and the work will begin within the next two months, officials added.

22.title: I never thought I will play 100 Test matches, God has been kind: Virat Kohli
22.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli, who will feature in his 100th Test starting tomorrow, said that he never thought he will play 100 Test matches. "It has been a long journey...I am just grateful that I have been able to make it to 100. God has been kind," he said. Kohli has scored 7,962 runs in 99 Tests.

23.title: Irfan Pathan congratulates Kohli on 100th Test, calls him 'magical physio'
23.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Instagram to congratulate Virat Kohli, who will feature in his 100th Test for India tomorrow. "Test cricket was limping & that's when it found a magical physio in Kohli. He came, he conquered & he made everyone love Test cricket all over again! Congratulations on your remarkable achievement," Irfan wrote.

24.title: Tesla German Gigafactory approval decision to be declared tomorrow
24.article_body: The German state of Brandenburg will be announcing its decision on approval for the planned Tesla Gigafactory near Berlin in a news conference on Friday. "The approval procedure for the e-car and battery factory of...Tesla in Gruenheide in Brandenburg is nearing completion," the state government said. Earlier, reports had said Tesla had won final approval from the state environment office.

25.title: Who is Viktor Yanukovych, who may be Russia's pick for Ukraine President after war?
25.article_body: Russia is reportedly backing exiled former Ukraine President Viktor Yanukovych to take charge if the current regime falls. Yanukovych came to power in 2010 but was overthrown after violent protests in 2014. Protests erupted after he refused to sign a trade deal with EU as he sought closer ties with Russia. He had escaped to Russia, allegedly with Russian help.

26.title: How can Indian investors trade in US stocks like Tesla through NSE IFSC?
26.article_body: Indian retail investors will be able to trade in eight US stocks, including Tesla, through NSE IFSC platform from today. The platform's market makers will buy shares in US and issue receipts against them to investors. The receipts, issued at low costs, will represent a fraction of the value of shares. Trading in receipts will take place in US dollars.

27.title: 249 students from Himachal still stuck in Ukraine: CM Jai Ram Thakur
27.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur on Thursday said that 249 students from the state are still stranded in war-torn Ukraine and that the efforts were being made at war-footing to evacuate them to neighbouring countries. "The parents of 163 students have been contacted," he said. Thakur thanked PM Narendra Modi for roping in Indian Air Force for evacuation.

28.title: YouTube's creators contributed ₹6,800 cr to Indian GDP in 2020: Report
28.article_body: Google-owned YouTube on Thursday said its creator ecosystem in India contributed ₹6,800 crore to India's GDP and supported an equivalent of 6,83,900 full-time jobs in the country in 2020. YouTube cited an Oxford Economics report while sharing the company's economic impact in India. "Impact [of our creators, artists] on the economy's overall success will only continue to accelerate," YouTube said.

29.title: 3,726 Indians to return from Ukraine today: Union Minister Scindia
29.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Thursday said 3,726 Indians will be brought back home on Thursday. "With all hands on deck and the direction of PM Narendra Modi ji, we will get 3,726 of our people back home today," Scindia said. Eight flights are scheduled from Bucharest, two from Suceava, one from Kosice, five from Budapest and three from Rzeszow.

30.title: I don't do the PR looks actors do; don't feel the need to be seen: Abhimanyu
30.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree's son, actor Abhimanyu Dassani said he's quite content with the pace of his career and doesn't get bothered by the pace of other actors' careers. He added, "I don't feel the need to be seen. That's why you...don't see me doing the PR looks people do." Abhimanyu said as an actor he'd just like to do "good work".

31.title: From one self-made actor: Yami thanks Kangana for praising her in A Thursday
31.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actress Yami Gautam thanked Kangana Ranaut after she praised her for 'A Thursday'. On Wednesday, Kangana shared a poster of the film featuring Yami on her Instagram Stories, and wrote "Congratulations to Team...@yamigautam." Yami shared Kangana's post, and wrote, "Thank you Kangana. Means a lot, especially when it comes from one self-made actor to another."

32.title: BJP workers hit my car with sticks in Varanasi, told me to go back: Mamata
32.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday alleged that yesterday, during her visit to Varanasi, some BJP workers hit her car with sticks and asked her to go back. "Yesterday, when I was going to ghat from the airport, I saw some BJP workers...Stopping my vehicle. They hit my car with sticks and told me to go back," Banerjee added.

33.title: Ukrainian diplomats in Russia moved to Latvia amid war
33.article_body: Ukrainian diplomats in Moscow have been moved to Latvia amid the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. The diplomats had left Moscow and crossed the Latvian-Russian border on Wednesday night, Latvia's Foreign Minister Edgars Rinkevics tweeted on Thursday. Latvia, last week, had said that it would give refuge to the diplomats after receiving their plea for help.

34.title: Massive landslide blocks Jammu-Srinagar National Highway
34.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Traffic Police on Thursday morning informed that a massive landslide near Banihal town in Ramban district of the state has blocked the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway. Vehicular movement on the highway has, thus, been suspended, the traffic police added. A video showing boulders tumbling down the hill at the Shabanbas area on the highway was shared by ANI.

35.title: Russian soldiers are 'confused children who have been used': Ukraine President
35.article_body: In a video address to the nation, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on Russian soldiers to "go home", and described them as "confused children who have been used". Zelenskyy also asked Ukrainians to keep up their resistance. His comments came as Russia acknowledged for the first time since the start of invasion that nearly 500 Russian troops have been killed.

36.title: Chinese company Huawei accused of tax evasion in India: Report
36.article_body: A tax investigation on China's Huawei Technologies allegedly found that the telecoms equipment maker manipulated account books to reduce its taxable income in India, Reuters reported citing a government source. On Thursday, the Finance Ministry said that a "major telecom group" did not account for income of ₹400 crore in its books and couldn't justify expenses of ₹480 crore.

37.title: Will explore all options to restore OBC quota for local polls: Maha Min
37.article_body: Speaking on restoration of Other Backward Class (OBC) quota in the local bodies' elections, Maharashtra OBC welfare minister Vijay Wadettiwar said that the state government will discuss the matter and explore all options to restore it. This comes after BJP alleged that the state government did not properly study the report prepared by MSBCC before submitting it to Supreme Court.

38.title: Sarpanch nominee digs up roads, damages street lights after losing in Odisha
38.article_body: Upset over his defeat in elections, a sarpanch candidate in Odisha's Gajapati district allegedly dug up roads and damaged street lights on Monday. Barik Sabar had lost to Haribandhu Karjee in Gangabada panchayat of the district. He along with his supporters reportedly damaged the road near Badadebula village and put stones on the way, thus, blocking communication with five villages.

39.title: Don't kick out Chelsea's owner Abramovich from English football: Neville
39.article_body: Talking about Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich who's been termed one of Vladimir Putin's closest friends by Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss, ex-Manchester United player Gary Neville said Abramovich shouldn't be "kicked" out of English football. Abramovich has announced his decision to sell Chelsea with net proceeds from the sale set to be donated to "victims of the war in Ukraine".

40.title: Naveen's death a reflection of NEET's shameless face: Kumaraswamy
40.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that the tragic death of Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar in Ukraine is a reflection of the NEET's "shameless face". NEET is causing injustice to talented but economically vulnerable rural students in the guise of qualification, he added. The youngster's death has made India question its "self-conscience", he further said.

41.title: India's COVID-19 death toll suspect, says Chidambaram citing Science journal
41.article_body: Citing the academic journal Science, Congress leader P Chidambaram said the official number of deaths due to COVID-19 in India is suspect. "The COVID-19 toll in India between 1/6/2020 and 1/7/2021 was 32,00,000, eight times the official toll of 4,00,000," Chidambaram tweeted. "Government’s figures suggest that the average number of deaths per village was less than one! Unbelievable!" he added.

42.title: Audio streaming platform Pocket FM raises $65 million in funding
42.article_body: Audio streaming platform Pocket FM announced it has raised $65 million in its Series C round of funding. The round was led by Goodwater Capital, Naver and existing investor Tanglin Venture Partners. Founded in 2018 by Rohan Nayak, Nishanth Srinivas and Prateek Dixit, Pocket FM offers content in Hindi, Bengali and Tamil. It had raised $22.4 million in December.

43.title: Meerut jeweller dies by suicide over ₹3 crore debt: Police
43.article_body: A 45-year-old jeweller, reeling under a debt of ₹3 crore, has died by suicide in Meerut, police said. His body was found at his residence in the Thatherwada area of the city. Apart from debt, a dispute with his wife and brother forced the deceased to end his life, police added. Meanwhile, his brother has alleged foul play suspecting murder.

44.title: Would go with Vihari over Shubman as he hasn't made any mistake: Jaffer
44.article_body: With Cheteshwar Pujara dropped from India Test squad, Wasim Jaffer said he would go with Hanuma Vihari over Shubman Gill at the number three position as Vihari hasn't made any mistake to miss out. Jaffer added that Vihari hasn't got "many" chances after his 259-ball 62*-run partnership with Ravichandran Ashwin, in the Sydney Test of India's 2020-21 series against Australia.

45.title: Idea of 'nuclear war' spinning in Western politicians' heads: Russia
45.article_body: Amid war between Russia and Ukraine, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said, "It's in the heads of Western politicians that the idea of a nuclear war is spinning constantly and not in the heads of Russians." This comes a day after Lavrov said that if World War 3 takes place, it would involve nuclear weapons and be destructive.

46.title: Producers will be in shock: Prabhas on low cap on movie ticket prices
46.article_body: Discussing the decision by the Andhra Pradesh government to place a low cap on the prices of movie tickets, actor Prabhas said producers of films like his movie 'Radhe Shyam' will be in "shock". "It takes away 40-50 percent of business so it's a big loss," added Prabhas. Prabhas is known for acting in the 'Baahubali' film franchise.

47.title: Won't be easy for whoever comes in place of Rahane, Pujara: Rohit
47.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said it won't be easy to fill the shoes of veteran batters Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane, who have been dropped from the squad for Sri Lanka Tests. He added, "What they've done for this team, you can't put it out in words." Rohit further said, "It's not written...that they won't be considered [in future]."

48.title: UP people want Yogi, not ones who build palaces, buy cars: Ravi Kishan
48.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Kishan has said that UP people would vote for CM Yogi Adityanath in the ongoing elections as he's an "educated man and living a monk's life". Kishan said people don't want ones "who want to decorate their palaces and buy fancy cars". He said this in an apparent reference to SP's Akhilesh Yadav and BSP supremo Mayawati.

49.title: Laughed, cried during narration; agreed on spot: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai...'
49.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he was "laughing through tears" during the narration of 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. "I had a tissue box kept on the table which got over by the end of the narration. I was entertained, moved," he said, adding, "I agreed then and there on the spot to be a part of this film."

50.title: 4 IAF aircraft evacuate 798 Indians from Romania, Hungary, Poland
50.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) on Thursday said four IAF C-17 aircraft have evacuated a total of 798 Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine using airfields in Romania, Hungary and Poland. IAF added that the aircraft also supplied 9.7 tons of relief material. Additionally, three more C-17 aircraft have taken off for the three countries to bring back remaining Indian nationals.

51.title: Netflix co-CEO announces $1 mn donation towards Ukraine relief
51.article_body: Netflix Co-founder and co-CEO Reed Hastings has announced a $1 million donation to an organisation providing emergency relief to Ukraine. In his tweet announcing the donation, Hastings thanked Russian-born Evgeny Afineevsky, who directed the Oscar-nominated documentary 'Winter on Fire: Ukraine's Fight for Freedom' for Netflix in 2015. Netflix has reportedly suspended all future projects in Russia.

52.title: Govt dismisses report claiming 19 lakh kids lost parent to COVID-19
52.article_body: The Ministry of Women and Child Development has dismissed a study by Lancet, which claimed that 19 lakh children in India lost a parent or caregiver to COVID-19. "These findings have no correlation with ground reality in India as reflected from field findings," the ministry said. It added the number of children affected by COVID-19 in India stands at 1,53,827.

53.title: Nobody is asking correct questions, says Rohit during press conference; video viral
53.article_body: A video of India captain Rohit Sharma saying, "Nobody is asking correct questions" during a press conference went viral. A reporter asked him whether first Test against Sri Lanka is going to be played on outfield as he wasn't talking about pitch. "Nobody is asking me questions related to crowd, pitch, team combination. It's good for me actually," Rohit joked.

54.title: I am perceived as a bully, vulture in the TV industry: Urvashi Dholakia
54.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said she is perceived as a "vulture" and too strong-headed like a "bully" in the television industry, adding that there are a "lot" of people who have not appreciated her. "I have just been a woman who has her own opinions. Whether you like it or you don't, that's not my problem," stated Urvashi.

55.title: Kohli keeps track of the performances of every RCB player: Shahbaz
55.article_body: Talking about former RCB captain Virat Kohli, RCB player Shahbaz Ahmed said Kohli keeps track of the performances of every player in the franchise, adding that he shares his feedback at times as well. "Kohli is a bowler's captain. He supports bowlers massively," stated Shahbaz who was signed by RCB for ₹2.4 crore in the mega auction.

56.title: Man lures 16-yr-old girl for car ride, rapes her in vehicle in Gurugram
56.article_body: A man allegedly lured a 16-year-old girl on the pretext of giving her a ride in his car and later raped her inside the vehicle in Gurugram late Tuesday night, police said. The girl's mother had filed a missing complaint about her, following which the police launched a search operation and found her. Subsequently, police registered a case of rape.

57.title: US baby becomes 1 of 100 people in the world diagnosed with 'Uncombable Hair Syndrome'
57.article_body: A mother from US' Georgia has taken to Instagram to raise awareness about her one-year-old son Locklan Samples' rare genetic condition called Uncombable Hair Syndrome (UHS). Locklan, nicknamed Lock by his parents, is one of the 100 confirmed cases of Uncombable Hair Syndrome in the world. This genetic condition affects children from the age of three months to 12 years.

58.title: Taiwan invasion is next, China's Xi is watching with glee: Trump on Russia-Ukraine war
58.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, former US President Donald Trump said, "Taiwan is going to be next. Just watch Taiwan. [Chinese] President Xi is watching with glee." "President Xi happens to be a man with a high intelligence level...He saw the way that we left Afghanistan..and this is his opportunity to do what he wants to do," he added.

59.title: Kohli has a better cover drive and technique than Babar: Brett Lee
59.article_body: Brett Lee said Virat Kohli is one of the three players who have a "better" technique and cover drive than Babar Azam, with the other two being Joe Root and Kane Williamson. Lee added that Babar will be Australia's "biggest" threat during the tour of Pakistan. "You have to get Babar out early. That's...Australia's greatest way to win," stated Lee.

60.title: Traffic to be diverted in Hyd for Vice Prez Naidu's visit on March 4
60.article_body: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu will visit Hyderabad on March 4 (Friday) and in view of this, the traffic is expected to either be stopped or diverted from Begumpet to Jubilee Hills. The route where the traffic might be stopped or diverted includes PNT Flyover, Shyam Lal building, HPS Begumpet, Begumpet Flyover and Punjagutta Flyover, the Telangana Police said.

61.title: Ukraine seizes secret battle plans left behind by Russian troops; shares pics
61.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry said, "Russian occupiers are losing not only equipment and manpower...In panic attacks, they are leaving classified documents." It claimed Ukraine's forces have gained access to classified planning documents of the Russian Navy's Black Sea Fleet. Ukraine said the documents included a working map, operational order, tables of call signs, signals and a list of personnel.

62.title: Amazon gods will have to come down to talk to us mortals: Future Retail in SC
62.article_body: Amazon's counsel on Thursday in the Supreme Court proposed talks with Future Retail and Reliance to end months-long legal battles between the companies. After Amazon's proposal, advocate Harish Salve, representing Future Retail said, "Amazon gods will have to come down to talk to us mortals." He asked, "What is preventing Amazon's boss from calling up Biyanis (Future Group's Kishore Biyani)?"

63.title: Japanese discount store operator to support 100 Ukrainian refugee families
63.article_body: Japan's Pan Pacific International, which operates a major discount store chain, said it would support 100 Ukrainian families approved by the Japanese government to enter the country as refugees. The company will provide financial support and job opportunities for refugee families, it added. The Japanese government has not yet specified how many refugees it would accept from Ukraine.

64.title: Ukrainians can get visas on arrival: UAE after reports of tightening norms
64.article_body: The UAE has said that Ukrainians will continue to be eligible for visas on arrival in the country. This comes after Kyiv's embassy in the Gulf Arab state, without offering a reason, said that visa waiver for Ukrainian citizens has been temporarily suspended. Notably, lakhs of Ukrainians have reportedly fled their country after the Russian attack.

65.title: UK rejects Russian demand to sell stake in Bharti Global co-led OneWeb
65.article_body: The UK has rejected Russia's demand for it to sell its stake in satellite firm OneWeb to allow a satellite launch. "There's no negotiation on OneWeb: the UK government is not selling its share," UK Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng said. OneWeb was bought by the UK government and India's Bharti Global in a bankruptcy rescue deal in 2020.

66.title: Taiwan faces massive blackout; outage hits around 55 lakh homes
66.article_body: Taiwan faced a massive blackout on Thursday reportedly due to a malfunction at a power plant in southern Kaohsiung city, which subsequently led to the failure of an ultra-high voltage station in neighbouring Tainan. State-run power firm Taipower said that the outage hit around 55 lakh homes, adding that power was restored in about 40 lakh of those.

67.title: 4 including head chef, waiter killed as car hits motorcycles in Gurugram
67.article_body: Four employees of a restaurant in Qutub Plaza in Gurugram, including a head chef, a waiter, a cleaner and a delivery boy, died after a speeding Skoda car allegedly rammed into their motorcycles on Wednesday. Police said driver of car was drunk. The deceased have been identified as Jitendra Mandal, Rajnish Mandal, Gopal Singh and Govind Kumar.

68.title: My main concern is regarding Ashwin's fitness for 1st Sri Lanka Test: Ojha
68.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has expressed concern over spinner Ravichandran Ashwin's fitness ahead of the first Test against Sri Lanka. "Ashwin's absence could prove to be a big factor. If he's fit, then good but if he's not, then who will Team India play instead of him?" asked Ojha. Ashwin missed the West Indies series due to an unknown injury.

69.title: My 1st thought was 'I can't', 2nd was 'I won't': Rohit on playing Ambedkar
69.article_body: Actor Rohit Roy, while talking about playing BR Ambedkar in grand musical 'Babasaheb', said his first thought was 'I can't do it' and second was 'I won't do it'. "How do you prepare for a role like this in ten days? I read script for second time...I thought I have to do this...it is once in lifetime opportunity," he added.

70.title: BJP fighting for its existence in UP Assembly polls: SBSP chief
70.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief OP Rajbhar on Thursday said, "The BJP is fighting for its existence in this election." He also said that BJP won't be able to even cross the double-figure in eastern Uttar Pradesh. "In the assembly constituencies of Ballia, Mau, Azamgarh, Ambedkar Nagar and Ghazipur, BJP won't be able to open its account," he added.

71.title: PM will be shown black flags during his Pune visit on March 6: Cong
71.article_body: Pune Congress has planned to show black flags to PM Narendra Modi during his visit to the city on March 6 for his remarks on Maharashtra in Parliament, Pune Congress chief Ramesh Bagwe said. He added that the party has taken permission from police. PM Modi had stated that Maharashtra had encouraged the spread of COVID-19 in other states.

72.title: Provide specific reservation for transgenders: Madras HC to TN govt
72.article_body: The Madras HC recommended to the Tamil Nadu government to provide a specified percentage of special reservations for the Transgenders/Third Gender (TG) in future public employments, apart from other relaxations extended to the socially and economically backward classes. Justice MS Ramesh made the recommendation while allowing a batch of writ petitions from Saratha, a TG, and seven others.

73.title: I was in hospital 3 days before participating in Miss Universe: Harnaaz Sandhu
73.article_body: Miss Universe 2021, Harnaaz Sandhu, said she did not imagine being the crown holder and wasn't ready to participate in contest. "It was my mother who said that you need to participate this year. I was in hospital for three days before participating. I learnt about my celiac disease, that I am allergic to gluten. I didn't know," she said.

74.title: Have united with SP to oust BJP from Uttar Pradesh: Shivpal Yadav
74.article_body: Speaking on forming an alliance with SP for the UP Assembly elections, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party chief Shivpal Yadav said that he has united with nephew Akhilesh Yadav to ensure the ouster of the BJP government in UP. "When I had started touring the state, there was only one demand from you all that 'chacha-bhatija' should unite," Shivpal said.

75.title: I'm not scared: WB CM on being stopped by BJP workers in Varanasi
75.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said she is "not a coward...[and is] not scared" as BJP's "loss is imminent". This comes after "BJP workers" stopped her vehicle enroute to a SP-led rally in Varanasi. "They hit my car with sticks and told me to go back...I got down...and faced them to see what they can do," Banerjee added.

76.title: Every Haryana district to get a 200-bed hospital: Governor Dattatreya
76.article_body: Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya on Wednesday announced that 200-bed hospitals will be opened in every district in the state. "The state government has [also] proposed to set up a medical college in every district," he added. Governor Dattatreya further said that government medical colleges are being set up in Bhiwani, Jind, Mahendragarh, Kaithal, Sirsa and Yamunanagar districts.

77.title: 'What the hell was that?', says reporter as explosions light up Kyiv skyline on live TV
77.article_body: Massive explosions in Ukraine's capital Kyiv in the early hours of Thursday were caught on camera just as a reporter was recording a video. CBS News' Charlie D'Agata was coming off the air when the sky lit up behind him "almost like lightning" and explosions were heard. "What the hell was that?" the reporter can be heard saying.

78.title: 175 nations agree to legally-binding UN treaty to end plastic pollution
78.article_body: In all, 175 countries have agreed to forge an international legally-binding agreement by 2024 to end plastic pollution at United Nations Environment Assembly on Wednesday. The treaty has been hailed as a "triumph by planet earth over single-use plastics" by UN's Inger Andersen. It would tackle plastic at different levels in its life cycle, including production, design and disposal.

79.title: BJP took donations from Bombay bomb blasts accused Memon's firm: NCP MLA
79.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) MLA Anil Gote alleged that former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis and BJP took ₹20 crore from RKW Developers Limited and other developers with alleged links with late Iqbal Memon after 2014. Memon was accused in the 1993 Bombay bomb blasts. Gote, a former BJP MLA, filed a complaint against BJP and Fadnavis with Enforcement Directorate.

80.title: TN govt sets up one-member panel to probe Smart City irregularities
80.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Wednesday formed a committee to look into the implementation of the Smart City project in the state. The one-member panel comprising retired IAS officer PWC Davidar will inquire whether projects were implemented in accordance with the guidelines. It will also check whether government grants were released and utilised as per guidelines, among other irregularities.

81.title: Ukraine-born Russian millionaire found hanging in his £18-million UK mansion
81.article_body: Ukraine-born Russian millionaire Mikhail Watford was allegedly found hanging by his gardener in his £18-million mansion in UK's Surrey. "His state of mind might have been affected by the situation in the Ukraine. The timing of his death and the invasion...was surely not coincidental," his friend said. The 66-year-old's name wasn't on the list of people sanctioned by UK government.

82.title: Reports on Chinese-Russian coordination on Ukraine are fake: China
82.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry said reports on Chinese and Russian coordination ahead of Russia's attack on Ukraine are "fake news". Such practices of diverting attention and shifting blame are "despicable", it added. This comes after The New York Times, citing US officials, reported that Chinese officials had asked Russian officials to delay the invasion of Ukraine until after Beijing Olympics ended.

83.title: Goa to resume economic activities with 100% capacity, says CM
83.article_body: The Chief Minister of Goa, Pramod Sawant, informed that the expert committee has advised resuming all the economic activities with 100% capacity in the state following a drop in the COVID-19 cases. "The government will take the decision by tomorrow & will resume the activities including casinos," the CM added. As of Wednesday, there were 209 active cases in Goa.

84.title: Pune's Aundh-Baner saw most suspected dengue cases between Jan-Feb
84.article_body: Aundh-Baner ward in Pune reported the highest number of suspected dengue cases in the city at 28 between January 1 and February 25. The city had reported a total of 272 suspected cases of dengue in this period. Keshavnagar had the lowest suspected cases at three, while no cases were reported from Warje-Karvenagar and Kondhwa-Yewalewadi.

85.title: Man kills friend for not returning ₹30,000 he borrowed in Navi Mumbai
85.article_body: A 21-year-old man, identified as Jai Shankar Umesh Prasad, was arrested on Tuesday by Navi Mumbai Police for allegedly stabbing his 45-year-old colleague and friend with a screwdriver after the deceased failed to return ₹30,000 he had borrowed. On Monday, the duo had an argument after which Prasad stabbed him. He was nabbed when he tried to flee to Bihar.

86.title: B'luru International Film Festival begins; 200 films to be screened
86.article_body: The 13th edition of the Bengaluru International Film Festival (BIFFES) has started today. During the festival, which will be held till March 10, more than 200 films from around 55 countries will be screened at three locations, including Orion Mall's PVR Cinemas, in Bengaluru. BIFFES will also pay tribute to late actor Puneeth Rajkumar and will screen his three films.

87.title: MHA approves formation of Village Defence Groups in J&K
87.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has approved the formation of Village Defence Groups (VDG) in Jammu and Kashmir. As per the revised scheme, persons leading the group in more vulnerable areas will receive ₹4,500 per month while other volunteers will receive ₹4,000 per month. The VDGs will function under the SP or SSP of the concerned district, the order said.

88.title: Man arrested for raping & torturing daughter for 3 yrs in Mumbai
88.article_body: A 50-year-old rickshaw driver was arrested by Mumbai Police on Tuesday for allegedly raping and torturing his 22-year-old daughter since 2019. The victim's mother was booked as she allegedly inflicted burn injuries on her. He impregnated her but she was allegedly given pills for abortion by her mother. A probe is underway to know if he raped his other daughter.

89.title: Don't judge Russians by one person's decision: Leysan on Russia-Ukraine crisis
89.article_body: Actress Leysan Karimova, who's currently in India, is worried about her family in Russia amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. She said, "My condolences to all people who lost their families...For me, Russians and Ukrainians, [are] all brothers and sisters, I don't see any difference between these two nationalities." "Please don't judge the whole nation by [one person's decision]," she added.

90.title: One hell of a ride, we want to make it special for him: Rohit on Kohli's 100th Test
90.article_body: On the eve of India-Sri Lanka Test which will mark Virat Kohli's 100th Test match, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "It has been one hell of a ride for him and it will continue to be in the coming years." Rohit added, "We definitely want to make it special for him, let’s hope we have good five days of cricket."

91.title: I was cleaner than Monica from 'Friends': Courteney on being 'clean freak'
91.article_body: Actress Courteney Cox said that she is a clean freak and that she was "a little" cleaner than the character of Monica that she played in the show 'Friends'. "Well, I think that I wasn't typecast, but maybe a little bit. I think that I added to the cleanliness of Monica, she was very competitive," she said.

92.title: HC orders Andhra Pradesh govt to develop Amaravati as capital city
92.article_body: Andhra Pradesh High Court on Thursday ordered the Andhra Pradesh government to develop Amaravati as the state's capital and to not use the 33,000 acres of land pooled from farmers. HC also ordered to hand over developed plots to farmers in three months. The state government was planning to dump the Greenfield capital city project and instead build three capitals.

93.title: Maharashtra government is dedicated to Dawood: Fadnavis
93.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, who has been calling for state minister Nawab Malik’s resignation, said the latter has been arrested but his resignation has not been taken yet. "This is a Dawood (Ibrahim) samarpit (dedicated), Dawood sharan government. This government (MVA) is coming together to save people who keep relations with Dawood," Fadnavis added.

94.title: You can do better NYT: Serena as paper prints her sister's pic in story about her
94.article_body: Tennis player Serena Williams tweeted, "You can do better, The New York Times," (NYT) after the newspaper wrongly published her sister Venus Williams' photo instead of her in a story. The story was about Serena raising $111 million for her new early-stage venture capital firm. "No matter how far we come, we get reminded that it's not enough," she added.

95.title: Oil soars to highest since 2008, hits $116/barrel as Russia invades Ukraine
95.article_body: Oil prices soared to $116 a barrel on Thursday, the highest level since 2008, as buyers continued to reject Russian crude following its invasion of Ukraine. The invasion has sparked supply concerns across commodity markets from energy to grains. Meanwhile, the OPEC+ has stuck with the 4,00,000 barrel-a-day production increase that was scheduled for April.

96.title: Illustration shows PM Modi submerged in water & acting as bridge for Indians in Ukraine
96.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal shared an illustration on India's evacuation efforts in Ukraine. It shows PM Narendra Modi half submerged in water as Indian citizens climbed on him to cross the water. Citizens of Pakistan, China and US are seen shouting for help while caricatures of their leaders peek out from walls. "PM...Modi ji, India's 'Bridge of Hope'," wrote Goyal.

97.title: Indian family of 4 post video seeking help from Ukraine, say 'unable to get out of Kyiv'
97.article_body: An Indian family stuck in Ukraine has posted a video online, seeking help from Indian Embassy for evacuation. "We are a family of four. Myself Dr Rajkumar Santhalani...and my son...is having fever, and we are unable to get out of Kyiv," Santhalani said in the video. This comes after the government said that no Indians are left in Kyiv.

98.title: 4 car thieves try to run over police personnel in Delhi, arrested
98.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested four thieves, involved in stealing cars, as they tried to run over two police personnel near the IIT Metro Station. They were booked on the charge of attempt to murder, police said. One of the accused, who was driving a stolen car, lost control and rammed into a tree, police added.

99.title: Housing society in Greater Noida fined ₹1 crore for water pollution
99.article_body: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) imposed a fine of ₹1 crore on Supertech's Eco Village-1 society for dumping untreated sewerage into a rainwater drain in violation of norms. So far, this is the biggest penalty amount imposed by GNIDA for water pollution. The authority has asked the developer to remit the fine amount within a week, officials said.

100.title: UK couple paint their house in colours of Ukraine flag to show solidarity
100.article_body: A UK couple, Rend and Michael Platings, has painted their house in the colours of the Ukraine flag to show their support for the country. "We've got friends in Ukraine, they're really lovely people, very brave...We just wanted to...let them know we're not forgetting about them," Michael said. The couple said they believe "Russia has been the aggressor, the bully".

101.title: IMD predicts heavy to very heavy rain in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry
101.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall in parts of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry due to a low-pressure area over central parts of south Bay of Bengal. The system is likely to intensify into a deep depression and is most likely to head towards north Tamil Nadu during the next 48 hours, IMD said.

102.title: CISF personnel who joined duty after break kills self at Chennai airport
102.article_body: A Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel died by suicide in the washroom of the Chennai Airport on Thursday. The 27-year-old personnel had joined duty after a break. "The incident happened around 07:15 am, one of the housekeeping staff checked restroom around...07:30 am and alerted the officials...a doctor immediately rushed to area...and declared him dead," an airport official said.

103.title: Full assault on truth: US accuses Russia of blocking independent news outlets
103.article_body: The US has accused Russia of launching a "full assault on media freedom and the truth" by blocking independent news outlets and preventing Russians from hearing news of the invasion of Ukraine. "Russia's government is also throttling Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram platforms that tens of millions of Russians...rely on to access independent information and opinions," US State Department said.

104.title: Best thing that could've happened to me: Julia Fox on dating ex-boyfriend Kanye
104.article_body: Speaking about her relationship with her ex-boyfriend, Kanye West, Julia Fox said that it was the "best thing" that could have happened to her. Julia added that being together with Kanye was like hitting a reset button. "It kind of brought a spark back into my life that I had kind of forgotten about," she said.

105.title: Need to focus on Make In India, manufacture sustainable products: PM
105.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that the world is looking at India as a manufacturing powerhouse. "We need to focus on Make in India, need to manufacture sustainable and qualitative products," PM Modi added. "We have to become self-reliant in the production of semiconductors. Make in India is the demand of the time," PM Modi stated.

106.title: Amazon, Future Group agree to hold talks to settle 18-month long legal dispute
106.article_body: During a Supreme Court hearing on Thursday, Amazon and Kishore Biyani-led Future Group agreed to initiate talks for an out-of-court settlement of the 18-month long legal dispute between the two. "No one is winning. FRL, Reliance and Amazon all have issues," Future Group's counsel Harish Salve said. The court granted them 10 days to explore settlement.

107.title: Shanaya, Lakshya to make their B'wood debut with Karan Johar's Bedhadak
107.article_body: Actors Lakshya and Shanaya Kapoor will make their Bollywood debut with the upcoming film 'Bedhadak'. The film's producer Karan Johar on Thursday made the announcement on his social media handles. Sharing the first poster of the film featuring Shanaya, Karan Johar wrote, "Introducing the gorgeous Shanaya Kapoor...I can't wait to see the energy she brings onto the screen!"

108.title: Kim Kardashian declared legally single amid divorce with Kanye West
108.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian has been declared legally single amid her divorce with rapper Ye, formerly known as Kanye West. In a virtual court hearing on Wednesday, Kim also officially and legally dropped 'West' from her last name as part of the bifurcated divorce proceedings. Issues of child custody and property are yet to be worked out.

109.title: Student shares sexually explicit morphed pics of university faculty in Punjab, held
109.article_body: Punjab Police have arrested a student for circulating sexually explicit morphed photos of faculty members of a private university. The accused was identified as Mohali resident Navjosh Singh Atwal. Atwal revealed he used to download porn material and then morphed the downloaded video content with photos of faculty members to circulate them by creating fake WhatsApp accounts using VPN.

110.title: Who is Fedorov, Ukraine's youngest minister urging tech firms to act against Russia?
110.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov has been calling on big tech companies, including Apple, Google and Meta, to completely isolate Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. The 31-year-old, who is Ukraine's youngest minister, had managed Volodymyr Zelenskyy's digital campaign in 2019 and it was so successful that Zelenskyy became President, reports said. Prior to politics, he ran a marketing agency.

111.title: China is provoking India at every turn: US diplomat Donald Lu
111.article_body: US' Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia, Donald Lu, said China is provoking India at every turn just as it is challenging US. Lu cited China selecting the regiment commander responsible for attack on Indian border as torchbearer at Winter Olympics in Beijing. Lu added US is working with India on bolstering its defence capabilities.

112.title: You're counting sips of water before off-shirt scene: Robert on 'The Batman'
112.article_body: 'The Batman' actor Robert Pattinson said "you're counting sips of water" before scenes with "your shirt off". Talking about how he had to watch what he was consuming before shirtless scenes, he said, "You just cut down and cut down and cut down." "I had three months before movie started...then you're working out before...after work all the time," he added.

113.title: Oracle suspends operations in Russia, SAP pauses sales
113.article_body: Oracle said it has suspended all operations in Russia, while SAP announced it will pause all sales, after Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov wrote letters to them requesting to end services to Russia. In response to Fedorov's request, Oracle said it had "already suspended all operations". SAP called sanctions against Russia "an important mechanism" in efforts to restore peace.

114.title: Chahar is slightly ahead of Bhuvneshwar for place in T20 WC squad: Irfan
114.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said pacer Deepak Chahar is slightly ahead of Bhuvneshwar Kumar for a place in India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "Bhuvneshwar has been doing well in the past few games, but when it comes to batting, Chahar has improved a lot. On that basis, I think he's ahead," Irfan explained.

115.title: Maharashtra Guv leaves Assembly midway amid slogan shouting
115.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari left the Vidhan Bhavan without completing his address to the joint session of the Houses amid slogan-shouting by MLAs. State Minister Jayant Patil claimed that MVA shouted slogans in praise of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, while BJP legislators raised "low level" slogans. The Governor had allegedly made controversial remarks over Shivaji Maharaj recently.

116.title: TIME magazine cover features Zelenskyy's quote, Ukraine calls it 'historic'
116.article_body: TIME magazine unveiled the cover of its upcoming edition. The cover image features the words spoken by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a speech addressed to European Parliament. The quote reads, "Life will win over death, and light will win over darkness." The official Twitter account of war-ridden Ukraine called the cover "historic".

117.title: Man, woman beaten up over alleged love affair in Raj
117.article_body: A man and a married woman were assaulted in Rajasthan's Ukheri over suspected love affair. The complainant alleged he went to a house in the village to ask for water when two men locked him inside. They, later, tied him to a wooden post with a woman present inside the house and beat them up, suspecting an affair between them.

118.title: Mukesh Ambani's $89.9 bn fortune nearly equals Russia's 4 richest men combined
118.article_body: India's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani currently has a net worth of $89.9 billion, which is nearly equal to that of Russia's four richest billionaires combined. Russia's richest man Vladimir Potanin has a net worth of $25.2 billion, as per Bloomberg, while Severstal's ex-CEO Alexey Mordashov and Novatek Founder Leonid Mikhelson's fortunes stand at $22 billion each.

119.title: Police seize opium from vehicle registered in NPP MLA’s name in Manipur
119.article_body: Police said around 34 kg of opium was seized by Narcotics and Affairs of Border (NAB) from a vehicle registered in the name of National People's Party's (NPP) MLA Langpoklakpam Jayantakumar Singh in Manipur on Wednesday. The driver of the vehicle was arrested. During interrogation, the accused confessed that he is an inter-state drug trafficker.

120.title: Ukraine explains why it was invaded by Russia
120.article_body: In a post on its official Twitter handle, Ukraine shared a link explaining why it was invaded by Russia. "Russian President Vladimir Putin has spared no effort to promote the false historical narrative that Ukrainians and Russians constitute 'one nation'," Ukraine said. "Putin cannot tolerate core values and DNA of Ukrainian society...so he is seeking to destroy them," Ukraine added.

121.title: Nissan ex-exec gets 6-month suspension for helping ex-CEO hide pay
121.article_body: Former Nissan executive Greg Kelly has been given a six-month suspended sentence for helping former CEO Carlos Ghosn hide pay from financial regulators, in Tokyo. A judge suspended Kelly's sentence for three years in his ruling on Thursday, ending months of trial proceedings. The two executives were arrested in Tokyo in November 2018 and charged with various financial misconduct offences.

122.title: 4 killed, 2 children injured as SUV rams into houses in Andhra Pradesh
122.article_body: Four people were killed and two children sustained injuries when an SUV travelling at a high speed lost control and rammed into their houses in Andhra Pradesh's Kadapa district on Wednesday, police said. The victims were relaxing on their cots in front of their houses, police added. "The children are out of danger...their condition is stable," police further said.

123.title: Don’t let COVID-19 vaccine doses get wasted: Centre writes to states, UTs
123.article_body: The Centre has asked the states and union territories to ensure that COVID-19 vaccine doses do not get wasted in private or government vaccination centres due to expiry. In a letter, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare noted that "earlier also directions have been issued to specific states of West Bengal, Karnataka, Kerala and Maharashtra" in this regard.

124.title: They need outlet: Official on wellness session for Kamathipura sex workers
124.article_body: India Post held wellness session for sex workers of Kamathipura in Mumbai. Session reportedly focused on healthy meals and importance of sharing personal problems. It lasted for over three hours. "They need outlet...A heart-to-heart conversation...I decided to start programme to make them feel comfortable in reaching out to government as they do with NGOs," Postmaster General Swati Pandey said.

125.title: Leopard skin seized during search operation in Odisha, 1 arrested
125.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of the Odisha Police seized leopard skin and arrested one person on Wednesday. The search operation was conducted with the help of Ramgiri forest officials in the Gajapati district, a senior STF official said. "The accused has been detained and handed over to Ramgiri forest officials for necessary legal action," the official added.

126.title: 'The Batman' makers unveil film's special video on Burj Khalifa, video surfaces
126.article_body: The makers of the movie 'The Batman' unveiled a special video of the film on the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. The text in the video said, "It's not just a signal, it's a warning. Unmask the truth." The text was followed by images from the film's trailers. "Our favourite Caped Crusader has taken over #BurjKhalifa," Warner Bros Pictures wrote on Instagram.

127.title: Amazon CEO pledges logistics, cybersecurity support for Ukraine
127.article_body: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in a tweet pledged the firm's support to Ukraine saying the firm is using its logistics capability to get supplies to those in need and cybersecurity expertise to help governments and companies. "Amazon stands with the people of Ukraine, and will continue to help," he said, calling the situation in Ukraine "deeply concerning".

128.title: What could be better for Kohli's 71st hundred than his 100th Test: Jaffer
128.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that there can't be a better opportunity for Virat Kohli to score his next hundred than the occasion of his 100th Test in Mohali against Sri Lanka. Kohli hasn't scored a century in international cricket since November 2019. "We all are eagerly waiting to see the old Virat," Jaffer added.

129.title: Police to contact ordnance factories to trace explosives found in Gurugram house
129.article_body: The police have decided to contact various ordnance factories in order to trace the origin of explosives found in a vacant house in Gurugram Sector 31. "We will be writing to ordnance factories in Khagaria (MP), Muradnagar (UP) and Sivakasi Fire Factory in Tamil Nadu, which manufacture these kinds of ammunition to identify their probable buyers," the police said.

130.title: Voter turnout will be historic in Purvanchal region: BJP's Ravi Kishan
130.article_body: As polling for the sixth phase of UP Assembly polls began on Thursday, BJP MP from Gorakhpur, Ravi Kishan, said that the voter turnout will be historic in the Purvanchal region. "We will win all nine seats in Gorakhpur mandal…BJP will get over 300 seats," Kishan added. "The people of UP have decided to establish Ram Rajya here," Kishan stated.

131.title: Man punches 7 Asian women in US in span of 2 hours; arrested
131.article_body: New York Police have arrested and charged a man for allegedly punching seven Asian women in separate attacks in the span of just over two hours. The assaults reportedly took place on Sunday night from 6:30 to 8:37 pm in Manhattan. The victims were aged between 19 and 57, and they were attacked without any provocations, police said.

132.title: Vladimir Putin's statue removed from a museum in Paris, pics surface
132.article_body: Grevin Museum in Paris has removed the wax figure of Russian President Vladimir Putin in protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Today it is no longer possible to present a character like him...for the first time in the museum's history we are withdrawing a statue because of historical events currently under way," museum director Yves Delhommeau said.

133.title: I don't talk Hindu-Muslim, our party doesn't discriminate: Rajnath Singh
133.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that BJP doesn't discriminate against people on the basis of caste or religion. "I don't talk about Hindu-Muslims, I don't believe in it. I don't see differences between Hindu, Muslim, Christian, or any religion. Our party doesn't differentiate between people in the name of religion," he said when asked about BJP's alleged anti-minority image.

134.title: Director Milap Zaveri loses 32 kg in less than a year, shares pic
134.article_body: Filmmaker Milap Zaveri lost around 32-kg weight in less than year. He took to Twitter to share a picture of himself and revealed that he now weighs 98.6 kg. In an interview with Hindustan Times, he revealed that he had started his weight loss journey in July last year when he weighed around 130 kg.

135.title: China asked Russia to delay Ukraine invasion until after Olympics: Report
135.article_body: A Western intelligence report indicated that Chinese officials asked Russian officials not to invade Ukraine until after the Beijing Olympics ended, NYT reported citing US officials. However, it didn't indicate that the country's Presidents Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping discussed a possible invasion when they met during Olympics on Feb 4. These claims are "speculations", a Chinese official said.

136.title: EV charging stations in Russia display 'Putin is d***head' as Ukraine firm hacks them
136.article_body: Electric vehicle charging stations on a Russian motorway were hacked by a Ukrainian company with a message reading "Putin is a d***head". "Glory to Ukraine / Glory to the heroes / Death to the enemy," other messages read. The Ukrainian company, that provided parts for the chargers, hacked them using a backdoor in the chargers' control systems.

137.title: 22-yr-old drowns in Gujarat dam while taking selfie, police finds phone with last videos
137.article_body: A 22-year-old man drowned while taking a selfie near Kakrapar dam in Gujarat's Surat district on Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Hitesh Rabari, a native of Banaskantha. Hitesh had gone to Kakrapar dam along with his three friends. Police said the deceased's mobile phone was recovered which contains his selfie videos taken before the incident.

138.title: 12th edition of Bengaluru India Nano to be held from March 7-9
138.article_body: The 12th edition of the three-day-long Bengaluru India Nano event with 'Nanotech for Sustainable Future' as its central theme will be held from March 7-9, said Karnataka Minister Dr Ashwathnarayan CN. Over 10 countries and 2,500 registered delegates will be participating in the summit which will have over 40 companies showcasing its nanotech products, services, and innovation and poster sessions.

139.title: Mumbai Police Commissioner shares personal mobile number on Facebook
139.article_body: In a move to maintain law and order in the city, the newly appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey shared his personal mobile number on Facebook and asked people to contact him directly to share their suggestions. "Suggestions big or small are all welcome...I too will share with you what work we are doing on a weekly basis," he said.

140.title: They started blowing the trumpet: Shantanu on parents' reaction to 'Gangubai...'
140.article_body: When asked about his parents' reaction to his film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', actor Shantanu Maheshwari said, "Honestly, I had just told them that I'm part of the film but [I] didn’t...give much details." "They went to watch the film on Friday, and fir toh dhindora peetne lage (they started blowing the trumpet)...They asked everyone around them to watch it," he added.

141.title: Congress doing politics on Indians stranded in Ukraine: Naqvi
141.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi criticised Congress for doing "politics" over the issue of Indian citizens stranded in Ukraine. "The government is making constant efforts to bring Indian students from Ukraine. On the other hand, Congress is doing politics in a crisis situation like this," Naqvi added. "It's nothing but stupidity," he stated.

142.title: 15-yr-old student dies after fight with classmates in school in Hyd
142.article_body: A 15-year-old student of class 10 of a private school died on Wednesday after a fight with classmates in Hyderabad, police said. The boy was allegedly hit by two of his classmates following an argument, police added. The victim had allegedly thrown a paper ball on one of his classmates which led to a fight, police further said.

143.title: Army jawan held in Thane for molesting foreign national on express train
143.article_body: An Army jawan has been arrested by railway police in Maharashtra's Thane district for allegedly molesting a foreign national on an express train. The accused has been identified as Sateesh T who hails from Kerala. Sateesh had allegedly molested a Portuguese woman who was travelling in Goa-Nizamuddin Express train between Kalyan and Kasara station in February 2019, the police said.

144.title: MMRDA conducts trial run for 'Make in India' metro rake between Aarey & Kurar
144.article_body: The MMRDA conducted a trial run for the first 'Make in India' metro rake on Phase 1 of Metro Line 7, between Aarey and Kurar, on Wednesday. Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray along with Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde inspected the work. The metro line will be opened to the public once the MMRDA receives required certifications, an official said.

145.title: Women's team win Air Pistol event to secure India's 2nd gold at shooting WC
145.article_body: India won its second gold medal at the ongoing ISSF Shooting World Cup in Cairo after Esha Singh, P Nivetha and Ruchita Vinerkar won the women's 10 metre Air Pistol team event. The trio defeated Germany's Andrea Katharina Heckner, Sandra Reitz and Carina Wimmer 16-6 for the medal. Earlier, 19-year-old Saurabh Chaudhary won gold in men's 10 metre Air Pistol.

146.title: Journey from watching his films to directing him unbelievable: Nagraj on Big B
146.article_body: 'Jhund' director Nagraj Popatrao Manjule said that the journey of watching actor Amitabh Bachchan's films to directing him has been "unbelievable". "I even became a filmmaker incidentally. My team and I shoot very casually, but since Bachchan sir was around on sets of 'Jhund' while shooting so, we had to be disciplined," he added.

147.title: 148 IAF aircraft to demonstrate capabilities at exercise 'Vayu Shakti' in Pokhran
147.article_body: A total of 148 aircraft of the Indian Air Force (IAF) will demonstrate their full spectrum combat and fire capabilities during exercise 'Vayu Shakti' in Pokhran on March 7. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be the chief guest, a senior IAF official noted. For the first time, Rafale fighter jets will also participate in the exercise, the official added.

148.title: Can we direct Putin to stop war?: CJI as lawyer approaches SC over students' evacuation
148.article_body: After a lawyer approached Supreme Court seeking directions to government for the evacuation of Indian students stranded in Ukraine, a bench headed by Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said, "Government of India is doing its work to evacuate Indians." "We sympathise with the students...But can we direct Russia's President Putin to stop the war?" CJI Ramana said.

149.title: Missile strike on building captured on camera as Ukrainian man takes selfie video
149.article_body: A man in Ukraine's Kharkiv captured the moment when a missile fired by Russian soldiers hit a building. The man was recording a selfie video wherein he was asking for donations. After the missile hit the building, the man ran for safety. In the video, debris can be seen flying across the room he's filming in.

150.title: Tesla, Google, Apple & 5 other US stocks to begin trading on NSE IFSC today
150.article_body: The NSE International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) platform in Gujarat's GIFT City will start trading in eight US stocks from today. The stocks include Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet (Google), Apple, Meta Platforms (Facebook), Microsoft, Netflix and Walmart. To make US stocks accessible to Indians, market makers will buy shares in US and issue unsponsored depositary receipts against them, NSE said.

151.title: Haryana starts help desk at Mumbai airport for students back from Ukraine
151.article_body: The Haryana government has set up help desk at Mumbai airport to help students returning from Ukraine. "We are in constant touch with government to ensure that all Haryana students are back safely and will assist them in every possible way," an official statement said. The Haryana government help desk at Delhi airport is also helping students returning from Ukraine.

152.title: Reliance to invest ₹1,670 cr in Sanmina to make electronics in India
152.article_body: Reliance Industries will be investing ₹1,670 crore in a joint venture with US-listed Sanmina for making electronic products in India. Reliance will hold a 50.1% stake in the JV after the investment in Sanmina's existing Indian entity. The new entity will serve both domestic and export markets. It aims to make hardware for 5G communications, among other things.

153.title: Tamil Nadu girl held for raising anti-BJP slogans gets ₹2 lakh compensation
153.article_body: Tamil Nadu's State Human Rights Commission (SHRC) has ordered payment of ₹2 lakh as compensation to a Canada-based girl student from the state. The girl was arrested for raising anti-BJP government slogans on a flight in which the then BJP state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan was a co-passenger in 2018. "Money be recovered from police personnel who arrested her," SHRC ordered.

154.title: Putin will go for blood beyond Ukraine, he wants a new Russian empire: Ukraine
154.article_body: Andriy Yermak, the head of the Presidential Office of Ukraine, has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin will "go for blood beyond Ukraine", adding, "He must be stopped." He further said that Putin wants to create a new Russian empire. Russia's war with Ukraine "could be a prologue to a greater European or even global massacre", he stated.

155.title: This may be the last time you see me alive, Zelenskyy told EU leaders on video: Report
155.article_body: An EU official has told Reuters that Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's concluding message to EU leaders' online emergency summit after Russia began invasion was, "This may be the last time you see me alive." Dressed in army fatigues, Zelenskyy was reportedly speaking from a bunker. Another official said, "There was a stunned silence and some had tears in their eyes."

156.title: India focussed on 2 things, we urge India to take clear position: US on Russian invasion
156.article_body: The US administration is trying to urge India to take a "clear position" on the Russia-Ukraine crisis, US diplomat Donald Lu said. "India has focused on two things when trying to explain its position. The possibility of a diplomatic resolution of this conflict. The second thing that they emphasise is India has 18,000 students still in Ukraine," he added.

157.title: 4,800 Indian students to be evacuated from Romania by Friday: Scindia
157.article_body: Around 4,800 Indian students will be evacuated from Bucharest and Suceava in Romania through 24 flights between Wednesday and Friday amid the Russia-Ukraine war, Jyotiraditya Scindia, Union Minister for Civil Aviation, said. India has been evacuating its citizens through special flights from Ukraine's western neighbours. On Wednesday, Scindia interacted with the Indian students in Bucharest.

158.title: Hospitals in Ukraine running out of oxygen amid war: WHO
158.article_body: The WHO warned that hospitals in Ukraine are running out of oxygen supplies amid the ongoing war.  "Critical shortages of oxygen will...impact...the ability to treat patients with COVD-19 and...other conditions," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. "At least three major oxygen plants in Ukraine have now closed and we're seeking ways of accessing oxygen from neighbouring nations," he added.

159.title: Noida Police retains top spot across UP in 112 response for 8th month in row
159.article_body: The Gautam Buddh Nagar Police has bagged the top spot in Uttar Pradesh for the month of February in terms of response time to emergency calls on the 112 service, official data showed. The response time was at 6.32 minutes in February, as per the data. The district has retained top spot among 75 districts in UP since July 2021.

160.title: 4 arrested with unaccounted gold worth ₹16 crore on Konark Express
160.article_body: Four people were detained by Government Railway Police (GRP) on Mumbai-Bhubaneswar Konark Express on Wednesday. The GRP became suspicious of the movement of the four accused and checked their luggage. They seized 32 kg of unaccounted gold worth ₹16 crore from their possession. The accused couldn't produce valid GST documents of the seized gold jewellery during investigation, GRP official said.

161.title: 6,000 people fined ₹3.31 crore for not wearing helmets in Pune
161.article_body: A total of 6,000 people were fined in Pune for riding their two-wheelers without a helmet in the first two months of this year, officials said. A fine of ₹3.31 crore has been collected from the violators. According to reports, the Pune Police department had collected ₹90 crore in fines from 18 lakh helmet-less riders in 2021.

162.title: Govt launches 'Stree Manoraksha Project' to improve women's mental health
162.article_body: Ministry of Women and Child Development (MoWCD) launched the 'Stree Manoraksha Project' in collaboration with NIMHANS Bengaluru on Wednesday. The project aims at improving mental health of women by enhancing the One-Stop Centres (OSC) across India. "New initiatives...will equip OSC functionaries with better understanding & resources to assist distressed women," WCD Minister Smriti Irani tweeted.

163.title: Never showed hand to any astrologer: Prabhas on playing palmist in Radhe Shyam
163.article_body: When asked if he believes in astrology, Prabhas, who'll portray the role of a palmist in 'Radhe Shyam', said he believes in "faith". "I never showed hand to any palmist," he added. "When I heard the story, I was surprised to get an offer to play a palmist in the film...It is a fight between love and destiny," Prabhas said.

164.title: Ukraine Prez urges Jews to speak up after Russia bombs Holocaust site
164.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy exhorted Jews to speak up after the Russians reportedly bombed Holocaust massacre site Babyn Yar in Kyiv killing five people. "Don't you see what is happening? Millions of Jews around the world, do not stay silent. Because Nazism is born in silence. Scream about murdering of civilians, scream about murdering of Ukrainians." he said.

165.title: Policeman shoots 12-year-old dead in US’ Philadelphia
165.article_body: The US' Philadelphia police shot dead a 12-year-old boy after a bullet hit their unmarked car. The police said they were in the area responding to some social media posts about a gun. One of the officers reportedly chased down the boy, who they claimed was fleeing carrying a gun, and shot him in the back.

166.title: Ukraine-returnee's family welcomes her in Delhi with flowers, feeds her
166.article_body: Family of Indian student who returned from Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis, welcomed her at Delhi airport. The family welcomed the girl, Ujjala Gupta, with garland and showered flowers on her. She was also fed at the airport. "I request the government to bring back the students stuck in Kyiv and Kharkiv as the situation there is serious," Ujjala said.

167.title: Premier League captains to wear armbands in Ukrainian colours to show support
167.article_body: Premier League captains will wear armbands in Ukrainian colours this weekend to show support for the country amid Russia's invasion. "The 20 club captains will wear special armbands...Big screens at stadiums will display 'Football Stands Together' against the backdrop of the blue and yellow colours of the Ukrainian flag," Premier League said in a statement.

168.title: Average temperatures rising across seasons since 1991: IMD
168.article_body: Average temperatures across seasons have seen a sharp upward trend in the country since 1991, according to IMD. The trend is in comparison to the average surface air temperature baseline recorded between 1981 and 2010. Heat waves associated with abnormally high temperatures over certain areas are also on a rise across the country.

169.title: 8-yr-old practising acrobatics in room accidentally hangs self with ribbons in Argentina
169.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died in Argentina allegedly after accidentally hanging herself while practising acrobatics with fabric ribbons in her bedroom. Her parents reportedly found her hanging from the fabric and tried to revive her. "It is not goodbye, it is see you soon Laylita. We are going to miss you a lot, Princess," her family wrote on social media.

170.title: Google to open some US, UK, Asia Pacific offices for 3 days/week in April
170.article_body: Google will require most employees in some of its US, UK and Asia Pacific offices to work from office three days a week from April 4, Reuters reported. Everyone coming to office will have to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have approved exemption. All fully-vaccinated employees won't have to wear masks in San Francisco Bay Area offices.

171.title: Don't want to criticise but govt lagging behind in Ukraine evacuation: Mamata
171.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the Central government over the evacuation of citizens from war-hit Ukraine and said that it is "lagging behind on matters of external affairs". "I don't want to criticise the government on matters of external affairs. But...we are lagging behind on this matter because of some coordination gap and political businesses," Banerjee said.

172.title: Amazon may file criminal case over Future's transfer of stores to Reliance: Report
172.article_body: Amazon is reportedly planning to initiate criminal court proceedings against Future Retail for allowing the transfer of assets to Reliance Industries. Earlier, Reuters reported that Mukesh Ambani-led RIL had started taking over 500 of Future's stores. The development came amid Future's ongoing legal battle with Amazon over its ₹24,713-crore sale of retail assets to RIL.

173.title: UAE suspends visa-free travel for Ukrainians as thousands flee war
