Sharing a picture from their wedding day on Instagram, Preity wrote, "Happy Anniversary my Love. I love you. Thank you...for loving all of me and for making me laugh all the time. You are my best friend & confidant...From Boyfriend-girlfriend to husband-wife and now mom-dad."

347.title: To my inspiration & role model: Rakul Preet Singh wishes dad on his b'day
347.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh wished her father Kulvinder Singh on his birthday. Taking to Instagram, Rakul Preet wrote, "Happy birthday to my inspiration, my role model. I look up to you every single day for the fearless strong person you are, for all the knowledge and wisdom you have. I'm the luckiest to have you guide me through everything."

348.title: Maha govt saving Nawab Malik who helped Mumbai blasts accused Dawood: Fadnavis
348.article_body: Calling for Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's resignation, former CM Devendra Fadnavis accused the state government of protecting him. "People whose hands are stained with the blood of innocent people who died in the Mumbai blast are being supported by the Shiv Sena-led government," he said. Malik was involved in money laundering with bomb blast accused Dawood Ibrahim, he said.

349.title: 22-year-old Indian student dies in Ukraine days after suffering stroke
349.article_body: Chandan Jindal, a 22-year-old student studying at the National Pirogov Memorial Medical University in Ukraine's Vinnytsia, passed away at a hospital in the city today. He hailed from Punjab's Barnala. He had suffered an Ischemic stroke in February and was admitted to the ICU. His father has written to Indian government to make arrangements for bringing back his body.

350.title: Maha govt refuses to allow unvaccinated persons to board Mumbai local trains
350.article_body: The Maharashtra government informed the Bombay High Court on Wednesday that it won't allow people not vaccinated against COVID-19 to board local trains in Mumbai. Last month, HC had asked the government to "let bygones be bygones" and start afresh. Expressing disappointment at the order, HC said today that almost all activities in Mumbai are being performed like pre-pandemic days.

351.title: Ukrainian refugees to get EU protection for up to 3 years: Germany
351.article_body: The German government has said that the European Union will offer immediate protection to refugees from Ukraine for up to three years. "We will provide help quickly and without bureaucracy. Refugees from Ukraine do not need to go through the asylum procedure," Germany's Interior Minister Nancy Faeser said. They will also get access to health insurance and jobs, she added.

352.title: 25-yr-old unidentified man killed, set on fire in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur
352.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed and set on fire by an unidentified miscreant near Yashoda Nagar bypass in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The unidentified victim's half-burnt body was recovered by the locals in the area after they spotted flames emanating from a hut. Before setting the victim's body ablaze, the accused had crushed his head and face with bricks, police said.

353.title: DK Shivakumar apologises for traffic jams in B'luru amid Mekedatu rally
353.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has apologised for traffic jams caused due to Mekedatu Padayatra in Bengaluru. Shivakumar said, "I want to apologise to the people of Bengaluru...There may be traffic trouble for three days...but it will solve your water-related issues for the next 50 years." "Our fight is for the people of [Karnataka] and citizens of Bengaluru," he added.

354.title: People knew I battled drug abuse; they wouldn't offer me jobs: Prateik
354.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said at his lowest phase in his career, he was "rejected by people many times". Prateik added for two years, he worked in plays "for free". "It was my own doing and my own battles that I was fighting...People [knew] about the substance and alcohol abuse I battled...[they] were wary of working with me," Prateik said.

355.title: Making Hrithik talk without moving a limb in Guzaarish was courage: Bhansali
355.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said lot of people felt his filmmaking was moving in the same direction. He added, "They had almost written off my career after...'Guzaarish'." Bhansali added he was fearless when he made 'Guzaarish'. "I [took Hrithik Roshan], who's considered...Greek God in Hindi cinema, who's known for dancing and action...[Making him talk] without moving a limb...was courage," he said.

356.title: SC to hear plea seeking FIR against political parties for bribing voters
356.article_body: The Supreme Court said it would hear a plea on Thursday seeking direction to register FIRs against political parties for inducing voters by offering freebies. "Election bribing is taking place everywhere...It's not for a particular state," CJI NV Ramana said. The plea demands disqualification of all members of Congress, SP in UP and AAP candidates in Punjab in Assembly election.

357.title: Google, Meta may face penalty for failing to open local offices in Russia
357.article_body: Google and Meta are among the firms that may face possible punitive measures in Russia over failure to open local offices and take other measures required by a communications law. The law requires foreign social media firms with over 5,00,000 daily users to open local offices. Besides Google and Meta, TikTok, Zoom and Twitter have also not established local offices.

358.title: It's not war, it's like India's surgical strike: India-born legislator from Putin's party
358.article_body: Indian-origin legislator and member of Russian President Vladimir Putin's party, Dr Abhay Kumar Singh, has come out in support of the military action against Ukraine. In an interview with Aaj Tak, he said, "This is not war; it's like India's surgical strike." "If the military enters a supermarket and...attacks Russian soldiers, we'll have to reply," he stated.

359.title: Google, MeitY list 100 Indian startups that'll get help to build apps
359.article_body: Google and India's Ministry of Electronics and IT's Startup Hub have unveiled the inaugural cohort of 100 Indian startups as part of Appscale Academy. The initiative aims to help startups build high-quality global apps and games. The startups were chosen from over 400 applications following a selection process that took into account their creative ideas and innovation, among other things.

360.title: Who is Joshua Davis, the 13-year-old boy who went viral after Biden's speech?
360.article_body: US President Joe Biden mentioned Joshua Davis, who attended his State of the Union speech, while discussing the need to cap insulin prices. Joshua was diagnosed with Type-1 diabetes when he was 11 months old and has raised awareness about the same since he was 4. During his speech, Biden wished Joshua, who turned 13 on Monday, a "happy birthday".

361.title: Samasta Hindu Aghadi chief Milind Ekbote booked for spreading misinformation
361.article_body: Samasta Hindu Aghadi's chief Milind Ekbote and 20 others were booked for distributing provocative pamphlets and circulating misinformation on social media to drive a wedge between two communities. The accused misled people about construction work at a Muslim shrine near Punyeshwar Mahadev Temple in Pune despite a court's stay and performed rituals there on Mahashivratri, the police said.

362.title: Kolkata woman raped by tantric on pretext of curing her ailing husband
362.article_body: An astrologer-cum-tantric was arrested for raping a woman on the pretext of curing her ailing husband in Kolkata's Chitpur. The woman alleged that the accused claimed he would perform yagnas to save her husband and took her to different places for performing rituals. She told police, he spiked her drink and raped her on two occasions when she became unconscious.

363.title: Russia's largest lender Sberbank to exit Europe, cites abnormal cash outflows
363.article_body: Russia's largest lender Sberbank is leaving almost all European markets after coming under pressure of Western sanctions that were imposed following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The group's subsidiary banks have faced abnormal cash outflows and threats to the safety of its employees and branches," it said. Earlier, the European Central Bank (ECB) ordered the closure of Sberbank's European arm.

364.title: Madras HC closes contempt case linked to river linking project
364.article_body: Madras High Court has closed a contempt case filed in 2017 by DMK leader M Appavu in connection with Tamil Nadu's Thamirabarani-Karumeniyar-Nambiar river linking project. There is no wilful disobedience of an order passed in 2015 with regard to the implementation of the project, HC said. No case is made out for initiating contempt proceedings, HC added.

365.title: Vehicles stuck in traffic for 4 hrs amid Mekedatu rally in B'luru: Report
365.article_body: Several vehicles were stuck in traffic snarl for about four hours due to the Congress' Mekedatu Padayatra in Bengaluru, a report stated. Meanwhile, Bengaluru Police has deployed about 1,000 policemen across the city following the Congress rally. Furthermore, the police has also issued an advisory of alternative routes for commuters to avoid getting stuck in traffic jams in the city.

366.title: We're ready for 2nd round of talks, not sure if Ukraine will join: Russia
366.article_body: Russian officials are ready to hold a second round of talks with Ukraine on Wednesday, but it's unclear whether the "Ukrainian negotiators will show up or not", Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday had said that Russia must stop bombing Ukrainian cities before more talks on a ceasefire could take place.

367.title: I clicked Alia & Ranbir's 1st picture when she was just 9: Bhansali
367.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he clicked Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's first picture together when she was just nine years old during Black's shoot. Bhansali added, "[I told Alia to] put her head on Ranbir's shoulders. She said 'no', she was...shy." "I [was] talking to Soni (Razdan) and suddenly I [saw] her head...on...Ranbir's shoulder...I [still] have that picture," he added.

368.title: DU female teacher says 2 colleagues harassed her; NCW writes to VC
368.article_body: A female teacher of Delhi University has accused her two male colleagues of harassing her and misbehaving with her. She alleged that the two teachers humiliated her by trying to stop her from attending a governing body meeting. The National Commission for Women has written to the Delhi University Vice-Chancellor to send an action taken report at the earliest.

369.title: 28-yr-old kills girlfriend in Delhi hotel over suspicion of affair
369.article_body: A 28-year-old man has been arrested from Uttar Pradesh for allegedly killing his girlfriend in Hotel Lak Residency in Delhi's Vasant Kunj area, police said on Tuesday. During interrogation, the accused revealed he killed the woman because she had been deceiving him and was in a relationship with another man, Deputy Commissioner of Police (southwest) Gaurav Sharma said.

370.title: People who mock Atmanirbhar Abhiyan can never strengthen India: PM
370.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said those who make fun of 'Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan' can never strengthen India. "People who mock Atmanirbhar Abhiyan, insult our (defence) forces...such dynasts can never strengthen India," PM Modi said while addressing a rally in Sonbhadra. "They are the same people who spread rumours about the country's COVID-19 vaccine," PM Modi added.

371.title: Even if Ishan performs with 60-70% of his ability, he'll be in team: Bangar
371.article_body: Former Team India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that Ishan Kishan will be India's top choice for the opening role at the T20 World Cup even if he performs with 60-70 per cent of his ability. "He plays with a strike rate which India need at the top order...he also provides the right-left combination at the top," Bangar explained.

372.title: Mumbai to soon get ward-wise helpline numbers for civic complaints
372.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is launching ward-wise helpline numbers to help citizens register civic complaints. The numbers for each of the 24 wards will be launched after current term of corporators ends on March 7. The helpline will address civic issues directly, a BMC official said. The existing helpline number 1916 will continue to operate, the official added.

373.title: Trinamool Congress wins 93 of 107 municipalities in WB civic polls
373.article_body: CM Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress on Wednesday steamrolled the Opposition by winning 93 of 107 municipalities in the civic polls, an SEC official said. TMC also won from Kanthi, the bastion of Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari. Congratulating the winners and thanking voters, Banerjee tweeted, "Let victory enhance our responsibility and dedication. Let triumph impart humility."

374.title: 3 armed men rob 2 men of their valuables during morning walk in UP
374.article_body: Three armed men robbed two men of their valuables during their morning walk in the Sector 11 market area in Ghaziabad's Vasundhara in UP on Tuesday, police said. "All the three men pulled out guns...made me take off my gold ring at gunpoint...snatched [my friend's] gold chain...asked him to take off his gold ring," one of the victims said.

375.title: Tons of space junk likely to punch a 20-metre deep hole in Moon
375.article_body: A leftover rocket weighing three tons is expected to smash into the side of the moon that faces away from the Earth at a speed of 9,300 kph on March 4. Scientists think this impact would likely carve out a hole 10 to 20 meters deep in the surface of the moon. Experts believe the junk rocket belongs to China.

376.title: RJD calls Bihar govt's new liquor order 'ridiculous'
376.article_body: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) criticised the Nitish Kumar-led government's announcement that people caught drinking alcohol will not be jailed but will be asked to share information on the liquor mafia and called it "ridiculous". The announcement proves that the liquor prohibition policy has failed in Bihar and it should be ended, RJD spokesperson Mrityunjay Tiwary said.

377.title: Alert sounded in Mumbai-bound flight after man smokes cigar mid-air
377.article_body: A smoke alert was sounded in a Mumbai-bound flight after a 36-year-old man lit up cigar mid-air in the plane's bathroom. Subsequently, the plane's crew rushed to the bathroom, extinguished the cigar and asked the man to be seated. The man, who said he hadn't acted deliberately but was only curious, was later arrested for endangering the life of others.

378.title: Over 2,500 Chinese nationals in Ukraine have been relocated: Official
378.article_body: Over 2,500 Chinese nationals stranded in Ukraine have been moved out of the country, Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Wang Wenbin said on Wednesday. Chinese citizens reportedly travelled from Kyiv and Odessa, among other places, to Poland, Slovakia and Moldova. Around 6,000 Chinese nationals resided in Ukraine either for education or work purposes.

379.title: Avesh Khan should receive same backing as Siraj: Irfan Pathan
379.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said pacer Avesh Khan should receive the same backing as Mohammed Siraj received from ex-captain Virat Kohli. "Kohli should be credited for the confidence with which Siraj bowls in international cricket. So yes, players need that backing. And I believe Avesh should [also] receive backing...because he has that talent," Irfan stated.

380.title: 7 teams formed to probe murder of 3 CNG station employees in Gurugram
380.article_body: Gurugram Police on Tuesday said seven teams have been formed to probe murder of three employees of a CNG station on a service lane off NH-48 in Sector 31. We're scanning footage of over 100 CCTV cameras, added the police. "Suspects were armed with sharp-edged weapons and didn't take much time to attack and flee," said ACP (Crime) Preet Pal.

381.title: Video of pre-wedding festivities of Supriya Pathak's daughter Sanah surfaces
381.article_body: A video from the pre-wedding festivities of actress Sanah Kapur, who will be marrying Mayank Pahwa, son of actor Manoj Pahwa, has surfaced. The video shows Sanah's mother and actress Supriya Pathak dancing with her sister and actress Ratna Pathak Shah. Pankaj Kapur had, on Monday, said, "I don't want to talk much, but yes it is my daughter's wedding."

382.title: US troops in Europe not to fight in Ukraine, but to defend allies: Biden
382.article_body: US President Joe Biden said American troops were deployed to Europe not to fight in Ukraine, "but to defend our NATO allies [if]...Russian President Vladimir Putin decides to keep moving west". The US has deployed troops to many NATO countries, including Poland, Latvia, Lithuania, and Estonia. Earlier, Biden had said that Putin wants to "re-establish the former Soviet Union".

383.title: 1,080 kg of sea cucumber worth crores seized in Tamil Nadu
383.article_body: Based on a tip-off, Coastal Security Group of Tamil Nadu Police conducted a raid at an old building near Akkaraipettai on Tuesday and seized sea cucumbers worth crores in international market. They recovered 248 kg and 812 kg of preserved and unpreserved sea cucumbers respectively, along with 4 kg preserved sea horses and 15 kg shark wings during the raid.

384.title: Constable on poll duty killed, 11 others injured in Manipur accident
384.article_body: An India Reserve Battalion (IRB) constable was killed and 11 others were injured in an accident in Manipur's Tamenglong district. They were reportedly going for poll duty to Manipur from Mizoram. Five of the injured were flown to Imphal for treatment. According to police, the driver might have lost control of the vehicle as the road was narrow.

385.title: If World War 3 takes place, it will involve nuclear weapons: Russia
385.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday that if World War 3 were to take place, it would involve nuclear weapons and be destructive. Lavrov further said that Russia would face a "real danger" if Ukraine acquired nuclear weapons. This comes a week after Russia ordered military operation in Ukraine.

386.title: Liquor vendors move HC against Delhi govt's order stopping discount on alcohol
386.article_body: A group of private liquor license holders have approached the Delhi High Court challenging the Delhi government's February 28 order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol. The government said the decision was taken in view of overcrowding at liquor shops. "The rules of the game cannot be changed after the game has begun," the petitioners said.

387.title: UGC draft rules allow institutes to source 40% content externally for online degrees
387.article_body: Institutes offering online degrees can source up to 40% of their course content externally and develop the remaining 60% in-house, as per UGC draft guidelines. This will prevent students from putting extra effort in locating good online programmes to pursue, a senior UGC official said. "The institutes themselves will do the research and provide options to students," the official added.

388.title: He's shaping up well: Bumrah on Ashwin's fitness ahead of Mohali Test
388.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has provided an update on Ravichandran Ashwin's fitness ahead of the Mohali Test against Sri Lanka, starting on March 4. "Ashwin is shaping up well...I'm not aware [if] there are any complaints...He was bowling, batting, fielding, he did everything," stated Bumrah. Ashwin was ruled out of the West Indies series due to an unknown injury.

389.title: Russia to investigate 21-yr-old Indian student's death in Ukraine: Russian envoy
389.article_body: Russia will investigate the death of the 21-year-old Indian medical student in Ukraine's Kharkiv, Russian Ambassador-designate Denis Alipov said on Wednesday. Alipov offered his "deepest condolences" over the death of Naveen Gyanagoudar and conveyed his sympathy to the student's family in Karnataka. "Russia will do everything to ensure the safety of Indians in conflict zones," he added.

390.title: Russian soldiers punching holes in their vehicles, crying, firing at each other: Reports
390.article_body: Russian troops in Ukraine are suffering from low morale and have deliberately punched holes in their vehicles' gas tanks, a Pentagon official said, reported New York Times. They are reportedly also suffering from food and fuel shortages. Voice recordings obtained by a British intelligence company reveal they were heard crying and sometimes even firing at each other, said reports.

391.title: Pathaan time starts now: SRK shares release date of his film 'Pathaan'
391.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to announce that his film 'Pathaan' will release on January 25, 2023 in theatres, adding, "I know it's late, but remember the date. Pathaan time starts now." 'Pathaan' also stars Deepika Padukone and John Abraham. 'Pathaan' marks Deepika's fourth film with Shah Rukh, having made her debut alongside him in 'Om Shanti Om'.

392.title: US sanctions on Russia won't affect us significantly: IAF Vice Chief
392.article_body: Vice Chief of Air Staff Air Marshal Sandeep Singh on Wednesday said US sanctions imposed on Russia amid the Russia-Ukraine war "won't affect us significantly". "Things are still unfolding. Our position is very strong and our relations with both the countries have remained (strong)," Singh said. He added that India's "relations with Russia will continue" despite a difficult geopolitical situation.

393.title: Robberies, rapes rising in Ukraine as govt arms civilians amid war: Man in video
393.article_body: In a video filmed in Kyiv on February 28, a man claimed that criminals in Ukraine have got their hands on military-grade weapons after President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's regime declared that it would arm all civilians willing to fight against Russia. "There have been robberies, rapes and all kinds of havoc due to this," he said.

394.title: Child cancer patients sheltered in basement in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war
394.article_body: A video has emerged that shows child cancer patients sheltering in a basement in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, amid the Russian invasion. Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko shared the video on Twitter and wrote, "Little cancer patients in Kharkiv basement. These are unfit conditions for children who suffer enough as it is already!"

395.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released, Shreyas Iyer jumps 27 spots
395.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with India's Shreyas Iyer jumping 27 spots to be ranked 18th. Meanwhile, KL Rahul dropped four spots to be ranked 10th. He is the only Indian in the top 10. Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka moved up six spots to be ranked ninth in the rankings led by Pakistan's Babar Azam.

396.title: Biden praises only Ford & GM in State of the Union speech; Tesla CEO Musk reacts
396.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to US President Joe Biden after he praised GM and Ford for investing billions on electric vehicles and didn't include Tesla in State of the Union address. "Tesla...created over 50,000 US jobs building EVs & is investing more than double GM + Ford combined. [FYI to person controlling this Twitter]," the Tesla CEO said.

397.title: India needs to be economically strong to not be lectured on freedom: Zoho CEO
397.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu in a tweet discussing India being "lectured" on democracy, freedom and the global order by others, said, "The only way for India not to get lectured is to be technologically self-reliant and economically strong." He added that sustained efforts will take India 10-20 years to achieve technological parity. "There are no shortcuts," Vembu said.

398.title: Pending bills worth ₹800 cr for traffic violations in Hyd: T'gana Police
398.article_body: Telangana Police said that pending bills for traffic violations amount to ₹1,500 crore in the state as nearly five crore challans remain unpaid by citizens. Hyderabad accounts for ₹800 crore worth of pending bills for traffic violations, it added. Most of them pertain to the last two years, some of the challans date back to 2014, Hyderabad Police stated.

399.title: Hyd software employee posts fake ad to rent out area on Quikr; held
399.article_body: A software employee has been apprehended for allegedly giving fake advertisements on Quikr and taking advance payments from people in Hyderabad. Police have seized a car and an iPhone from him. The accused gave an advertisement on the online platform about an office with a 2,400-square feet area and quoted ₹35,000 as rent and ₹50,000 as advance for it.

400.title: Never cheated in my relationship, might've been cheated upon: Ananya
400.article_body: Speaking about infidelity, actress Ananya Panday said she has never cheated in a relationship. "Maybe I have been cheated upon but I'm not sure," she added. Ananya's 'Gehraiyaan' co-star Siddhant Chaturvedi also said he's never cheated in a relationship. "It has to be...black or white for me. I cannot live in the grey area. It messes things up," he added.
